page.title: 12SHOPPING-BADLUARACH/SCORAIG
page.content: SHOPPING HAS CHANGED IN THE LAST 50 yrs. THERE USED TO BE 3 SHOPS ON THE BADLUARACH SIDE OF THE LOCH AND ONE ON THE SCORAIG SIDE.A STEAMER CAME IN ABOUT 3 TIMES A YEAR.PEOPLE BOUGHT SOME THINGS FROM THE SHOPS BUT MOST SUPPLIES CAME FROM THE LAND. NOWDAYS THERE IS NO SHOP ON EITHER SIDE. THE NEAREST SHOP IS AT LAIDE.THE BADLUARACH FOLK USE 3 MOBILE SHOPS WHICH COME TO THE TOWNSHIP WEEKLY.FOLK AT SCORAIG MOSTLY STOCK UP WITH GROCERIES WHEN THEY GO TO INVERNESS OR DINGWALL FOR ANIMAL FEED,BUILDING MATERIALS OR OTHER MAJOR ITEMS. PEOPLE FROM BADLUARACH AND SCORAIG ALSO USE THE WESTERBUS SERVICE TO INVERNESS.IT RUNS THREE DAYS A WEEK.
